nl.vrom.roo.util

Class Regexp

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.vrom.roo.util.Regexp

  • public final class Regexp
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class needed to use in schematron files and style sheets while using regular expressions. This because XSLT-1 does not support regular expressions.

        public static boolean matches(org.w3c.dom.Node node,

        Matches the value of the node against the regular expression

        regex - the regular expression needed to check
        Returns:
        true if the node value is compliant with the regular expression.

        public static int tokenCount(java.lang.String text,
                             java.lang.String regex)
        Count tokens separated by a regexp in a string
        Parameters:

      • stringJoin

        public static java.lang.String stringJoin(org.w3c.dom.NodeList list,
                                          java.lang.String delimiter)
        Joins strings contained in a list of nodes. The joined strings are separated with a delimiter character. This method corresponds of the XPath-2.0 function string-join.
        Parameters:
        list - the list of nodes to join the texts from.
        delimiter - the delimiter character
        Returns:
        a string containing a concatenation of all texts of the nodes.

      • stringJoin

        public static java.lang.String stringJoin(org.w3c.dom.NodeList list)
        Joins strings contained in a list of nodes.
        Parameters:
        list - the list of nodes to join the texts from.
        Returns:
        a string containing a concatenation of all texts of the nodes.

      • tokenize

        public static org.w3c.dom.NodeList tokenize(java.lang.String text,
                                            java.lang.String regex)
        Represents the XPath-2.0 function tokenize(string,regexp). Prevent the use of this XPath-2.0 function when there are enormous lists of data to process. This because of the large memory consumption and the bad garbage collection in XSLTC.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to split
        regex - the regular expression to use for splitting the text
        Returns:
        list of nodes containing the split text fragments
